RESTAURANT REVIEW / CHOOPATI GANGOTREE STREET CHIC
Gangotree Sweets and Chats is almost synonymous with chaat in Bangalore, with its first outlet opening its doors back in 1986. A tall order in itself, the second generation owner of the chain, Raj Sethia is experimenting with sweet and spicy favourites like never before. {mosimage}

In its new avatar, it houses an open-air seating space in Mantri Square Mall and goes by the name Choopati Gangotree. While you will still find pani puri on the menu, don't be afraid to try some of their new fare. There is a variety of stuffed parathas, masala pav, surprisingly non-greasy channa bhaturas and chaat items of the kind you may have never heard of before. Reluctant as you may be to sink your teeth into their highly recommended jalebi chaat, you will be in for a surprise.

Tangy, crunchy and sweet all in the right measure, the chaat is quite a delight to eat and look at too. It comes loaded with curd, sweet and spicy chutneys, a garnish of onions, coriander and capsicum. Live stations at the eatery ensure you get your plate of chaat prepared exactly to your taste. And while at it, do grab a glass of chilled khus sharbat to beat the heat. Meal for two Rs 300 At Mantri Sqaure Mall, Sampige Road, Malleswaram Tel 9448356848

By Prachi Sibal

CELEBRATING THE SUSTAINABLE
June 11
The annual festival of justice, peace and renewable communities-Bhoomi Habba is back in the city. From poster exhibitions to film screenings and talks, sale of organic crafts to traditional food from across the country-it will be a celebration of all things sustainable. AT Visthar campus, KRC Road, near Kothanur, off Hennur Road TIME 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.{mosimage}

A LAUGH RIOT
June 19
One of India's favourite comics, Vir Das is back in Bangalore with his new show Unbelievablish, where he shares stories from his life and journey and leaves it to you to decide if they are true or false. Laugh your way through Das' brand of comedy. AT MLR Convention Centre, Dyvasandra Industrial Layout Mahadevapura, Whitefield TIME 8 p.m. PRICE Rs 800 onwards
